text:
Example here of using the Tags within Text elements.
#1 is what happens, #2 is what I would’ve expected to see.

Hey!
The “Select” input `private-form__set` seems to come with some top margin that e.g. a “Text” input does not have.
It causes some UI inconsistencies if you have a Select field between Input fields. Maybe I’m using the components incorrectly, but thought I’d flag.

Hey Mattias, yes it is! There are some limitations, however. Please reference our docs to learn more about them. Let me know if you have any questions :slightly_smiling_face: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/ui-extensions/overview#limitations>

Hi all! We've changed the name of this channel from `#crm-customization-beta` to <#C05R599UA12|ui-extensions> to better reflect nomenclature in our docs and throughout our developer ecosystem. Please let us know if you have any questions.

Join this channel for peer to peer collaboration on building UIE Extensions.
text:
set the channel topic: :octagonal_sign: Official HubSpot Support is not provided in this Slack :octagonal_sign: For specific requests, please start at <https://help.HubSpot.com/>

Join this channel for peer to peer collaboration on building UIE Extensions.

Hello everyone. I'm building out my first UIE that gets some data from an external API and displays it. I'm running into an odd thing where everything is working fine. But if I pass in some invalid values to the query, it will return a 400 error - that part is fine. What's odd is that after I get that error, even sending through a valid query will still kick out the error response. If I reload the page, then sending through the valid query will return results. Do I need to clear some things out after I get an error or what might be happening here?
Yes, that makes a lot of sense. We are working on a fix, will update you asap:+1:
Ah, I figured it out. I needed to clear the error state in my calling function.

It would be fantastic if we could share state between cards. I have a serverless function that gets triggered by three different cards, and it returns the same data each time. It would be amazing to create a shared state and access it for each individual card.

A reminder to you all to not be like me - I've been running around saying "UIE Extensions" - as bad as saying "ATM Machine" :laughing: I was gently corrected today so now I'm paying it forward. :heart:

A tooltip component would be nice :thinkonk: I need to add explanations to a table and would prefer something simple that doesnt use too much space. I guess I'll have to create a button that pops something up instead :thinkonk:
Hi all, has anyone ever implement this component where we can have a *load more* in a multi-select component in a react ui-extension?
